I understand the delays in email so I'll take this route.  

I posted a new game last night but I totally forgot to add the 'Questnet Standard Library' and the 'q3ext.qlb' libraries in the .zip file.  Do I need to re-upload it with those files added?

I can't remember if those 2 libraries are the ones that come with Quest when you download it.

steve  8)

Posts.EditableText: I sent a reply via email shortly after you posted this. It said: Q3EXT.QLB comes with Quest anyway, so you don't need to include that. In fact, so does the QuestNet library - but I don't know why you've included this since it's a single-player game? You don't need to re-upload the game - I'll put it on the website when I get a moment
Posts.HTML:
I sent a reply via email shortly after you posted this. It said:

Q3EXT.QLB comes with Quest anyway, so you don't need to include that. In fact, so does the QuestNet library - but I don't know why you've included this since it's a single-player game?

You don't need to re-upload the game - I'll put it on the website when I get a moment

Posts.EditableText: Hey thanks a lot. The reason why the Questnet library was included was because this was my first game and I thought maybe by adding the library, it would add more commands. I don't know. steve

Posts.EditableText:
I don't recall seeing a bounced mail, but frankly I receive so many fake ones from stupid virus filters telling me that "I" sent a virus (when actually it was a virus faking my email address - as pretty much all email viruses do these days) that I could easily have just deleted it without noticing.

I haven't uploaded the game yet, but hopefully I'll get round to it later today.
